meanings.definition: Resembling a dwarf in size or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The tiny house had a dwarflike door that even children had to bend to enter.
meanings.sent2: The miniature garden featured dwarflike trees that added a magical touch.
meanings.sent3: The dwarflike kitten tried to climb the tall bookshelf but only reached halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her dwarflike stature in the crowd made her easy to spot.
meanings.sent5: The dwarflike mushrooms in the forest seemed to belong in a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics or qualities similar to those of a dwarf.
meanings.sent1: The actor's dwarflike costume for the play was incredibly detailed.
meanings.sent2: The garden gnome had a dwarflike beard and a mischievous smile.
meanings.sent3: The dwarflike statue in the park always made visitors stop and take a second look.
meanings.sent4: Her dwarflike determination to finish the race inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The dwarflike strength of the ant amazed the onlookers.
